intro: Lotononis multiflora, commonly known as the many-flowered lotononis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. The plant has hairy stems and leaves that are opposite and lance-shaped. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and open woodlands. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
